page.title: 11 Attitudes
page.content: Peoples attitudes towards Wickford as a shopping centre mostly point in one direction which is that Wickford is in desperate need for a department store, such as Marks and Spencers or Debenhams.The majority of the shoppers in Wickford are local people,and shop in Wickford only because it is near and convenient.The reason why Wickford does not attract out side customers is because of the lack of parking facilities and the shopping centre is not good enough to warrant customers from out of town.There is also tough competition from larger centres near by such as Basildon and Southend.In general opinion of the public Wickford as a whole wastes its potential growth as a major shopping centre by placing too many of the same kind of shops. Wickfords development has been met with mixed feelings from the locals.
